summary: This document is an email forwarding a notification about Ghislaine Maxwell's pretrial services intake following her arrest. It includes details about her charges, expected arraignment, and detention motion, and identifies her defense attorneys.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant facing charges including conspiracy to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex acts, transportation of a minor, and perjury.

persons.name: Chris Everdell
persons.context: Listed as retained counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell in the pretrial services intake form.

persons.name: Mark Cohen
persons.context: Listed as retained counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell in the pretrial services intake form.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge before whom Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment and bail hearing were scheduled.

connections.description: Chris Everdell is listed as retained defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell.
Mark Cohen is listed as retained defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell.
Both are listed as defense attorneys for Ghislaine Maxwell, indicating they are part of the same defense team.

events.title: Maxwell's arraignment and bail hearing
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to be arraigned and have a bail hearing before Judge Nathan.

events.title: Pretrial services intake notification
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's office sent notification of completed pretrial services intake form for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Email forwarding notification
events.description: An email was forwarded containing the pretrial services intake notification and related documents.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and arrived in the Southern District of New York, with plans to be housed at the MDC.
Maxwell faced charges including conspiracy to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex acts, transportation of a minor, and perjury.
Her defense attorneys were identified as Chris Everdell and Mark Cohen, both retained.
The government filed a motion for detention, indicating they sought to hold her without bail.
The document references docket number 20 Cr. 330 (AJN) for her criminal case.
